newInstance
The function creates a new instance of the specified object type.
Syntax
newInstance
(typeObj)
Parameter
Purpose
typeObj
An object type of the created instance.
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in Algorithm editor on the "Objects" tab.
To use the function, declare a new variable using the
var
function.
Specify the
newInstance
function as the value of the variable.
In the "Instantiating a type" modal window, select an object type which instance is created by the algorithm.
Next, fill in the attributes for the created instance of the object type using the
attrByVar
function.
All mandatory attributes must be filled in.
Save the variable using the
save
function.
The exception is when object in the
expression
or
event before saving
is created based on an object unsaved in the database whose attributes have
two-way relation
.
An example of using the function for this case is given in this
article
.
Example
The algorithm for creating an instance of the
business process
can be written as follows:
In order to write the algorithm, it will required to:
declare new variables using the
var
function;
as values
assigned
to variables, select the
newInstance
function to create new instances. As part of the example, you need to select "UD expertise" for the
expUD
variable and "WF. Instance of the running process" for the
prossUD
variable.
Several other functions are used in writing this algorithm.
See more
Process parameters (attributes) are specified using the
attrByVar
function;
The
value
of the "Application for decision-making" attribute is specified using the
currentObject
function.
The
value
of the "Object" attribute is assigned with the value of a variable.
The
value
of the "Process" attribute is specified using the
dict
function.
The
value
of the "Activity sign" attribute is specified using the
true
function.
The instance of each object type is saved using the
save
function.
